column1: Rheumatic Disease causing Pain &amp; Stiffness in Backbone
column2: SimplyMarvi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I received a spinal epidural yesterday to treat chronic pain and arthritis in my C-7-T1 vertebra. During the procedure, I started having muscle spasms in my mid back. These subsided upon applying an ice pack and taking a muscle relaxer. These have continued for 30+ hours so far. But I do have more back problems. Not sure if these spasms are from the celestone specifically, the procedure itself, or the the combination with the other meds injected (2 other steroids and Toradol).  Not sure if this Med has been used in any of my many previous injections. I'm also experiencing flushing and intermittent low grade fever,weakness, lack of appetite. Overall,  I have satisfactory results from these injections. Some last 3-6 months, others up to 2+ years. My physiatrist/pain specialist is rated #7 in his field, in the US.

column9: I had 2 injections in the cervical neck between 5/6, 8/14/09 for neck pain after having a cervical neck fusion between 5,6 & 6,7 a year and a half ago. So far a whole week without sleep except for maybe 1 or 2 hrs a night. Also I'm prone to depression. I have felt very bad. Even suicidal. Its been one of the most miserable weeks of my life. This inj. is supposed to last x 3 months. I can only pray the reactions I've had will cease soon.
